Documentation.name: UML Profile for GML Application Schemas
Documentation.notes: This profile defines a set of stereotypes and tagged values for defining XSD Schemas that follow the patterns used in XSD representations of GML Application Schemas. These follow the normative rules provided in GML 3.2 Annex E, and in proposed revision of ISO 19118. Implemented for Enterprise Architect tool by Simon Cox, CSIRO Exploration and Mining. Stereotype.name: Application Schema
Stereotype.notes: Model: Root of model describing an Application Schema. Contains definitions of feature-types and other components related to a single conceptually coherent application. This will normally have a single maintenance and governance framework. XML implementation: All Application Schema package contents are placed within one XML namespace.

Tag.name: owner
Tag.description: Party responsible for maintenance of this package

Tag.name: xsdDocument
Tag.description: Relative path to XML Schema document corresponding to this package.

Tag.name: targetNamespace
Tag.description: URI to unique target namespace

Tag.name: xmlns
Tag.description: Prefix associated with namespace

Tag.name: version
Tag.description: Schema version

Tag.name: gmlProfileSchema
Tag.description: an element gml:gmlProfileSchema with the content of the tagged value shall be created in an appinfo annotation of the schema element.

Stereotype.name: Leaf
Stereotype.notes: Model: Subset of model describing a schema. A leaf package shall not contain any other packages. XML implementation: All Leaf package contents or component classes are placed within one XML schema document.

Tag.name: xsdDocument
Tag.description: Relative path to XML Schema document corresponding to this package.

Tag.name: version
Tag.description: Schema version

Stereotype.name: noStereotype
Stereotype.notes: (NO STEREOTYPE) Model: Defines an object type. Instances shall have identity. XML implementation: Global element, whose content model is a globally scoped XML Schema type derived by direct/indirect extension of gml:AbstractGMLType, property type.

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: suppress automatic creation of *PropertyType complexType

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: enforce the 'by value' property pattern without xlinks

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: attribute group gml:AggregationAttributeGroup is added to the complex type of the feature type

Tag.name: xsdDerivation
Tag.description: class implemented as new type + element, or by applying constraints only

Stereotype.notes: Model: Defines an object type. Instances shall have identity. XML implementation: Global element, whose content model is a globally scoped XML Schema type derived by direct/indirect extension of gml:AbstractGMLType, property type.

Tag.name: noPropertyType

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: attribute group gml:AggregationAttributeGroup is added to the complex type of the feature type

Tag.name: xmlSchemaType

Tag.name: xsdDerivation
Tag.description: class implemented as new type + element, or by applying constraints only

Stereotype.name: FeatureType
Stereotype.notes: Model: Feature type, realization of GF_FeatureType as defined in ISO 19109. XML Implementation: Global element, whose content model is a globally scoped XML Schema type derived by direct/indirect extension of gml:AbstractFeatureType, property type

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: suppress automatic creation of *PropertyType complexType

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: enforce the 'by value' property pattern without xlinks

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: attribute group gml:AggregationAttributeGroup is added to the complex type of the feature type

Tag.name: xsdDerivation
Tag.description: class implemented as new type + element, or by applying constraints only

Stereotype.name: DataType
Stereotype.notes: Model: Defines a structured data type. The instances are not considered objects and shall therefore not have an identity. XML Implementation: Global element, whose content model is a globally scoped XML Schema complexType, property type This includes structured classes without identity. In a GML implementation this is implemented as a complexType element in which the attributes and associations are complexContent (sub-elements) but the type is *not* derived (transitively) from AbstractGMLType or AbstractFeatureType.

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: suppress automatic creation of *PropertyType complexType

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: enforce the 'by value' property pattern without xlinks

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: attribute group gml:AggregationAttributeGroup is added to the complex type of the feature type

Tag.name: xsdDerivation
Tag.description: class implemented as new type + element, or by applying constraints only

Stereotype.name: Union
Stereotype.notes: Model: Defines a union data type. XML Implementation: Choice group whose members are GML Objects or Features, or objects corresponding to DataTypes

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: suppress automatic creation of *PropertyType complexType

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: enforce the 'by value' property pattern without xlinks

Tag.name: hasXmlLang
Tag.description: axml attribute xml:lang shall be generated for the type representing the class

Stereotype.name: CodeList
Stereotype.notes: Model: Defines an extendable enumerated data type, consisting of code and value pairs. XML Implementation: Union of an enumeration and a pattern (default mapping, an alternative mapping is a reference to a dictionary)

Tag.name: asDictionary
Tag.description: implement as a dictionary instead of enumeration

Stereotype.name: Enumeration
Stereotype.notes: Model: Defines an enumerated data type. XML Implementation: Restriction of xsd:string with enumeration values

Stereotype.name: property
Stereotype.notes: Model: attribute or association role represents a 'property' of the containing class. XML implementation: local xsd:element, the type is either a property type (if the type is a complex type) or a simple type.

Tag.name: sequenceNumber
Tag.description: Specify position of attribute or association-end within content model implemented as an ordered sequence

Tag.name: inlineOrByReference
Tag.description: Constrain attribute or association-end to be implemented either inline or by reference only

Tag.name: isMetadata
Tag.description: flag that attribute or association-end is to be treated as metadata

Stereotype.name: multipleInheritance
Stereotype.notes: generalized class represents a 'property' of the containing class.

Tag.name: sequenceNumber
Tag.description: Specify position of attribute-group within content model implemented as an ordered sequence
